name: product_family
label: Product family
help:
CLARA product family refers to EUMETSATs CM SAF CLARA datasets.

CCI product family refers to the ESA Cloud_cci data with additional time range funded by the Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S).

labels.clara_a2: CLARA-A2 (CM SAF cLoud, Albedo and surface RAdiation dataset from AVHRR data)
labels.clara_a3: CLARA-A3 (CM SAF cLoud, Albedo and surface RAdiation dataset from AVHRR data)

name: origin
label: Origin
help:
Service, project or organisation in charge of the production of the data. There are 3 origins or producers in this dataset: C3S, ESA, EUMETSAT.
EUMETSAT is linked to the CLARA family ESA and C3S contribute both to the CCI family. C3S provides a time extension of the previous ESA data, keeping the same algorithms but using the sucessor sensor.

labels.eumetsat: EUMETSAT (European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites)

name: variable
label: Variable
help:
There are two families of variables: CLARA product family and CCI product family.
Both families contain the same variables, but variables of the CLARA product family can be downloaded individually, whereas variables of the CCI product family are provided all together in a single netCDF file.
Note that the two families are based on the data from different sensors and algorithms. They also differ in temporal and horizontal resolution. That is why they are organised as product families. Within each family there are two different providers or origins. The C3S origin acts as an extension of the previous provider for each family keeping the same sensors and algorithms but providing a time extension of the dataset.

labels.cloud_physical_properties_of_the_ice_pha: Cloud physical properties of the ice phase
labels.cloud_physical_properties_of_the_liquid_: Cloud physical properties of the liquid phase

name: sensor_on_satellite
label: Sensor on satellite for CCI product family
help:
CCI product family
ATSR2 (Along-Track Scanning Radiometer 2) on ERS-2
AATSR (Advanced Along-Track Scanning Radiometer) on Envisat
SLSTR (Sea and Land Surface Temperature Radiometer) on Sentinel 3A and 3B

name: climate_data_record_type
label: Climate data record type
help: Both the ICDR and the TCDR parts of each product family were generated using the same software and algorithms. The TCDR is intended to have sufficient length, consistency, and continuity to detect climate variability and change. The ICDR provides a short-delay access to current data where consistency with the CDR baseline is expected but was not extensively checked.

name: area_group
help: Select one widget from the choice below
label: Geographical area

details.text: With this option selected the entire available area will be provided

name: area
label: Sub-region extraction
help: Select a sub-region of the available area by providing its limits on latitude and longitude
